channel.title: 508 server error with run.bat
channel.description: i always get this error[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version n umber in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)[/code] idk what it means or anything i never did 508s b4 if its compiling error i compiled like 4 times please help....

item.title: 508 server error with run.bat
item.dc:creator: @Lumpylog Lumpylog
item.description:
@Lumpylog wrote:

[quote=“lukenuke75, post:3, topic:292897”]i have the jdk im not that dumb lol im just new to 508 lol[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 04, 2009, 11:43:37 am[/size][hr]also its not compiler its run.bat lmao
[/quote]
haha, I didn’t mean it like that, all the compilers are 1.6.0_06 and I’m not. So I was just wondering if that’s your problem, but I guess not. Try Posting your situation in the sticky, and it should be solved quickly!

item.title: 508 server error with run.bat
item.dc:creator: @Lumpylog Lumpylog
item.description:
@Lumpylog wrote:

I’m having the same problem.
But My JDK is jdk1.6.0_14, and none of the compilers work.
Go To Computer > C: > Program Files > Java and see what it says next, for example, JDK1.6.0_14.
If that’s the case, try using this compiler.

@echo off Title Misthalin.com Compiler echo Compiling - Please Wait . . . if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Compile Finished! echo This compiler will now terminate . . . Please copy any errors

If it doesn’t work theres nothing I can do for you, sorry.

Read full topic
